result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jonathan D Norwood-Pevey

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jonathan D Norwood-Pevey appeared by video.  Attorney Robert E Webb Jr appeared by video for Jonathan D Norwood-Pevey.  Prosecuting attorney Jon R Josephsen Jr. appeared in court on behalf of Annie Louk for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Final Pre-Trial. Discussion with parties. Due to defense unavailability with pre-selected dates, defense counsel requests adjourned final pre-trial and jury trial dates. No objections from the State. Court grants request. Any witness lists, special jury instructions, and motion in limine to be filed by 01/12/2022.  Case adjourned to Br 16.
Final pre-trial scheduled for January 19, 2023 at 09:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for January 23, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed. NOTICE OF MOTION AND MOTION TO ADJOURN

Defendant Jonathan D Norwood-Pevey in court with attorney Robert E Webb.  Patrick T. Franken appeared on behalf of Alexander Dyer for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Status Conference. Discussion with parties. Defense counsel advises that they have received discovery materials and an offer from the State. Court schedules Final Pre-Trial and Jury Trial dates, and sets 08/31/2022 deadline for filing trial documents. Case adjourned to Br 16.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 09:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report - 05-05-2022

Defendant Jonathan D Norwood-Pevey in court with attorney Robert E Webb.  Jon R Josephsen appeared on behalf of Alexander Dyer for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Status Conference.  Amended Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading and enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of his client. Defense counsel further advises court that they have received an offer from the state, but requests additional time to review with client. Case adjourned for a Status conference to Br 16.  Status conference scheduled for May 6, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 04.18.2022

Defendant Jonathan D Norwood-Pevey in court with attorney Robert E Webb.  Anthony J Moore appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Discussions with parties. Defense counsel advises that they have received discovery materials, but are still awaiting an offer from the state. Case adjourned to Br 16.  Status conference scheduled for April 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jonathan D Norwood-Pevey in court with Attorney Robert E Webb; both appear in person.  Matthew Zisi appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 16, Judge Grayson. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 2-8-22

Adjustment Number: 22A 013470,
Payable Number: 984308,
Receipt Number: 22RP005470,
Amount: $20.00

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Jonathan D Norwood-Pevey in court with attorney Robert E Webb.  Defendant Jonathan D Norwood-Pevey in custody.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jonathan D Norwood-Pevey appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 4.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
